subject: Business
title: Giving Feedback That Actually Lands
description: Learn Giving Feedback That Actually Lands in one minute.

hook.text: 'Your presentation was bad.' vs. 'The data on slide 5 didn't support your conclusion.' One helps. One hurts.

buildup.text: Effective feedback is specific, timely, and focused on behavior â€” not personality.

discovery.text: The SBI model works: Situation, Behavior, Impact. 'In the meeting (S), when you interrupted (B), it shut down.

twist.text: Positive feedback matters more than corrective. Gallup found teams need a 4:1 positive-to-negative ratio to thrive.

climax.text: Kim Scott's 'Radical Candor' says: care personally and challenge directly. Skip either and feedback fails.

punchline.text: Good feedback is a gift. Bad delivery makes it feel like an attack.

quiz.question: What ratio of positive to negative feedback helps teams thrive?
